projects.title: AR Animated Book
projects.desc: Augmented Reality Book using 3D Created Models delivered through Unity and Vuforia - shown here on a Pixel 2 XL.

projects.title: AR Business Cards
projects.desc: Augmented Reality Business Card with a purchased model rigged and animated through Maxamo and delivered through Unity and Vuforia - shown here on a Pixel 2 XL.

projects.title: Oil Rig
projects.desc: Virtual Reality Oil Rig simulation experience built as work for 3D Media, using existing models and introducing Telportation, Controller Interation, 3D Modelling, Particle Systems, Physics and Gameplay Elements - Created in Unity for the HTC Vive and Windows Mixed Reality.  Demonstrated here using a HTC Vive.

projects.title: PiARate Island
projects.desc: Augmented Reality PiARates child exploration experience built as work for Vivarra, using existing models and introducing Target-less, Ground Plane and Pinch/Touch resizing - Created in Unity using Vuforia.  Demonstrated here on a Google Pixel 2 XL.

projects.title: Zoe the Cheetah
projects.desc: Augmented Reality Dance experience built as work for Vivarra, using existing models and introducing Target-less, Ground Plane and Pinch/Touch resizing - Created in Unity using Vuforia.  Demonstrated here on a Google Pixel 2 XL.

projects.title: Spooky Scary Skeletons
projects.desc: Dancing Augmented Reality Skeletons using Model Rigging using Mixamo, Vuforia Ground Plane and Pinch/Touch resizing - Created in Unity using Vuforia.  Demonstrated here on a Google Pixel 2 XLl.

projects.title: Udacity Capstone
projects.desc: Work to complete a series of VR challenges, winning points as you progress. Create a VR project of your choosing, using any hardware. Choose from a wide range of achievements and each achievement wins a different number of points. To succeed, you need to reach the required points level.

projects.title: Wish You Had A Portal
projects.desc: As part of my Udacity ARKit With Unity course I built an Ipad Application that could detect flat-planes in the real world and spawn a portal gateway onto those planes.  I used ARKitâ€™s world tracking to walk into portals, teleport from world to world, then teleport back to reality and to allow the user to throw objects from the real world into the VR portal.

projects.title: Night At The Museum
projects.desc: A Virtual Museum Experience entitled A Night At The Museum, this is a Mobile based museum application consisting of at several information stations that demonstrate examples of how Virtual and Augmented Reality is impacting and disrupting the Marketing Industry. This project showcases locomotion, VR scene design, interactivity, and an understanding of the industry and is also a lot of fun!

projects.title: Storytellers Revenge
projects.desc: The Storyteller Revenge project required me to stitch together my own 360 video footage, correct the seams and horizon, adjust the color and edit the raw footage into a travel blog story. I then built a custom 360 video player in Unity and added video controls, emission particles for a water affect, titles, credits and an interactive navigation map that allowed the user to branch the travel blog to any location in any order.

projects.title: Maze
projects.desc: Built a 3D UI, waypoint-based navigation, clickable objects, and utilized spatial audio. Players navigate a simple maze then find a key that opens a gate to secret treasure. Utilized VR programming techniques like gaze-based interaction, raycasting, control structures, and more.

projects.title: Submarine
projects.desc: As part of the Intro to VR Course by Circuit Stream(Academy of VR) we were taught step by step through the development of an underwater Submarine game - adding in movement mechanics, creating targets, keeping score, blowing up targets, among other skills.

projects.title: Puzzler
projects.desc: I designed and developed a working Virtual Reality Puzzler app for use on Google Cardboard - A simple Simon-Says type puzzle where the user watches and mimics a sequence of illuminating lights using gaze/click. The setting is a VR dungeon-like environment with a mysterious and magical ambiance. I applied design techniques like ergonomics, personas, and rapid-prototyping to create the mobile VR application and create a public write-up for the game in the blog link above.

projects.title: Modern Apartment
projects.desc: Created a VR Modern Apartment experience to run on Google Cardboard.  Created a layout and loaded supplied mesh objects into the scene, placed them in the 3D virtual space, and assigned supplied materials and textures to create a realistic look. Added other furniture (including a kitchen) and added some high-performance mood lighting, which I optimized using the Unity advanced light-mapping tools to finish off the VR experience.
